alert.note: Alert for Macon (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 5:07PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Macon. * WHEN...Until 815 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 507 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tuskegee, Franklin, Davisville, Lake Tuskegee, Tuskegee National Forest, Liverpool, Society Hill, Warriorstand, Moton Field Municipal Airport, Uphapee Creek, I 85 Rest Area, Fort Davis and Creek Stand.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
